subject: Ethics
title: W.D. Ross and Prima Facie Duties
description: A micro-lesson that makes W.D. Ross and Prima Facie Duties usable.

hook.text: You promised to meet a friend, but a stranger collapses nearby. Which duty wins?

buildup.text: W.D. Ross said we have multiple moral duties: keep promises, do no harm, show gratitude, be just.

discovery.text: These are prima facie dutiesâ€”each one binds you unless overridden by a stronger duty.

twist.text: No fixed ranking exists. You must use judgment in each situation to weigh competing obligations.

climax.text: Ross offered a middle path: rules that matter deeply, but flex when they clash with each other.

punchline.text: Duty isn't a single voiceâ€”it's a chorus you must conduct.

quiz.question: What are W.D. Ross's prima facie duties?
options: Absolute rules that can never be overridden
Guidelines that only apply in professional settings
Moral obligations that bind unless outweighed by a stronger duty
